I do not have access to current data. however, i can give you an example of how the tourism industry could have evolved in a particular region during the last decade based on general trends.

let's take singapore as an example. over the last decade, singapore's tourism industry has evolved significantly. the country has become an increasingly popular destination for business and leisure travel with a growing number of visitors every year.

one of the main drivers of this growth has been the country's efforts to position itself as a top destination for meetings, incentives, conventions, and exhibitions (mice) tourism. singapore has invested heavily in world-class convention and exhibition facilities, including the marina bay sands expo and convention centre, which has over 120,000 square meters of space, making it one of the largest convention centers in asia.

in addition to mice tourism, singapore has also focused on developing its cultural and heritage tourism offering, which includes attractions like the national museum of singapore and the singapore botanic gardens. furthermore, the country has also been investing in its infrastructure, such as expanding its airport and public transportation system, to make travel to and within singapore more convenient and accessible for tourists.

finally, singapore has been leveraging the power of digital and social media to promote itself as a destination to a global audience. with the rise of platforms like instagram and facebook, singapore has been able to showcase its attractions and experiences to potential visitors in a visually engaging way.

in summary, the tourism industry in singapore has evolved over the last decade by focusing on mice tourism, cultural and heritage tourism, investing in infrastructure and leveraging the power of digital and social media.
